meanings.sent1: The strong wind can defoliate the trees in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The gardener used a special spray to defoliate the plant.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally defoliated my houseplant while trying to dust its leaves.
meanings.sent4: The caterpillars seemed to defoliate the entire garden overnight.
meanings.sent5: The autumn season always brings a natural defoliation to the trees.

meanings.definition: To cause the leaves of a plant to fall off.
meanings.sent1: The harsh weather can defoliate the bushes in our backyard.
meanings.sent2: The farmer defoliates the crops to prepare for harvest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to defoliate the tree by shaking its branches.
meanings.sent4: The disease spread quickly and defoliated the entire orchard.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillars voraciously defoliated the rose bushes in the garden.
